page.title: 18PROTECTION OF COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: Dangers of Development: The countryside around Askam and Ireleth is not only valuable farmland of high agricultural grade (Grade 3) but also of superb aesthetic value from a natural history point of view, but there are pressures to develop the land for other purposes, not the least of which may be industrial development such as chemical works similar to those in a nearby block. The land closest to the shore has its limitations for agricultural use but surrounding land is ideal for this purpose. The Duddon Estuary site itself is classified as an area of special scientific interest and is protected by policies which underline its importance. Indeed there are a number of nearby sites (SSI) which stretch around the estuary to Walney.
